oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate clothing requisition record
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Signed by Cpl. G. T. Poyner, Co. B, 5th Tenn. Inf., this form is signed by a surgeon and accounts for several different clothing items, incl. shirts, drawers, shoes, and socks. Poyner fought at Shiloh, Perryville, and Murfreesboro. He was wounded at New Hope Church, Geo. in May 1864. His wound required the amputation of his toes on his left foot. He remained on light duty until the end of the war.
